channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: CCPD & Haleon Info Session | Sept. 16
item.description: On Tuesday, 9/16, Haleon (a local employer) will be on campus to discuss their student programs and opportunities for co-ops, internships, and rotational roles. The event will be held from 5:30-7:30pm. Join the CCPD and Haleon for this exciting event just for RPI students! Registration and additional details are available in Handshake.

item.title: Working in the U.S.: CPT & Internships | Sept. 15
item.description: Date: Monday, September 15, 2025 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Join CCPD and ISSS for an in-person workshop to learn about the internship search and the ways to get Curricular Practical Training (CPT) to work in the U.S. before graduation! This session is for both undergraduate and graduate students. Registration required!

item.title: OGE Dissertation and Thesis Preparation Workshop | Sept. 16
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 16, 2025 12:00 PM - 1:30 PM - Learn the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles—plus a review of the most commonly found mistakes and ways to avoid them. This workshop is for any student who will be writing a MS thesis or PhD dissertation. Bring your questions! To register for this WebEx event: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScVfJONdDnqLJmBM1YWYt8rdBoIHCrMxri39nN2j4QPs_eLmg/viewform?usp…

item.title: ID Cards Required to Access Meal Plans in Dining Hall
item.description: We hope your semester is off to a great start! Please be reminded that starting immediately, all students with an active meal plan must present their valid student ID card to access meals in the dining halls. This policy helps ensure efficient service and accurate meal tracking.

item.title: DotCIO announces upcoming upgrade to SIS
item.description: Members of DotCIO’s Enterprise Information Services team are pleased to announce upcoming changes to SIS (Student Information System) on Wednesday September 17. Please note: SIS will be intermittently unavailable on this date from 5:00am – 8:00am to allow for the upgrade to take place. This upgrade brings a fresh look, improved navigation, and a more user-friendly experience. Click the title for a short video providing a tour of the new landing page and where to find the tools you use most.

item.title: Mercer XLab Fall 2025 Schedule and Information Directory
item.description: The Mercer XLab is NOW open 8 a.m. - 8 p.m. on weekdays during the Fall 2025 semester. All RPI students are welcome to learn from our Mercer X Student Workers! They can help you design your project, print your first PCB, learn how to solder, borrow electronic parts and instrumentation, and more. Come try Analog Devices Inc.’s new devices intended for “AI on the edge,” where small microcontrollers run your AI for image recognition and speech detection. We’ll see you soon on the JEC 6th floor!

item.title: 2025 Division of Finance Conference | Oct. 1 Register by Sept. 22
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 1, 2025 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM - RPI’s Division of Finance is excited to announce the 2nd annual Finance Conference on October 1, 2025. Come explore a curated lineup of interactive sessions designed to advance your professional skills and deepen your understanding of critical topics in higher education. From finance and data to leadership and IA, there’s something for every learner. The registration deadline is September 22, 2025.

item.title: Mainstreaming Mental Well-being: A Training Series for Faculty and Staff
item.description:
The Mainstreaming Mental Wellbeing (MMWB) Taskforce envisions an RPI community in which mental health and well-being are central tenets, both in and out of the classroom, and where all community members are challenged and supported to learn, grow, and develop. This training series will give you concrete knowledge, skills, and resources to play an active role in supporting student wellbeing at RPI.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
